page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: As much land as possible is ploughed for arable crops.Winter wheat is the most profitable followed by winter barley,spring barley and oats, oil seed rape and spring peas are used for break crops.Sheep farming involves breeding lambs and fattening them for slaughter;cattle are increasingly unprofitable due to the high cost of finance.The land is mostly good quality,medium loam overlying whinstone with patches of heavier clay and sand;in good seasons it yields well but the east coast climate with its cool summers and strong winds is a problem.The west half of the block is well sheltered with woods,but the east half which slopes down to the sea is almost entirely exposed to the north,east and south winds.
